rev.comment: /* Singles */ Keep paragraph sizes roughly even. Once SFTR's info can be expanded, than you can have three paragraphs.
{{pp-semi-blp|small=yes}} high volume of revisions and anons adding incorrect sales figures\

Protected 21 (Adele album): Persistent [[WP:Spam|spamming]]: repeated instances of anon editors changing sales figures and adding forums as sourced. constant reversions ([edit=autoconfirmed] (indefinite) [move=autoconfirmed] (indefinite))

don't introduce your idea of conflict in the article. In times of doubt, I think Billboard takes precedence. Let's wait for an official statement confirming the other two

3 sentences had the same structure; sounded too repetitive
sentence got repetitive, so maybe this solves it?
copy edit. somewhat akward phrasing here.
United World Chart is run by two German guys from their living rooms. It is not now, nor has it ever been, a valid chart. don't use it here
/* Notes */ this isn't needed since new source for 11 million
trying to fix the mess someone made

Undid revision 459298405 by [[Special:Contributions/99.14.141.32|99.14.141.32]] ([[User talk:99.14.141.32|talk]])"blue-eyed soul" becoming increasingly obsolete, due to its inherently racist foundation
Adele is not black, therefore she cannot sing 'soul'. It would either be folk or blue-eyed soul.
/* Background and titling */ tidied a paragraph for clarity and flow
/* Singles */ it actually says 3rd single, which also turned out to be wrong.
/* International */ Not even close to true, and I can't see what the poster was getting at. All relevant statistics are already mentioned.

Undid revision 456681565 by [[Special:Contributions/Iggy Ax|Iggy Ax]] ([[User talk:Iggy Ax|talk]]) none of these are valid sources

"Alternative rock" and "indie rock" are sub-genres of "Rock" so there's no need to state "rock" at all. Also, Adele and this album isn't close to rock. Alt rock is like Foo Fighters and Red Hot Chilli Peppers. Indie rock is small underground bands.
Undid revision 456028500 by [[Special:Contributions/193.93.102.249|193.93.102.249]] ([[User talk:193.93.102.249|talk]]) NO. please cite before changing
the entire sentence is written to convey to the idea that the record is for a female artist
Undid revision 455880675 by [[Special:Contributions/88.104.22.170|88.104.22.170]] ([[User talk:88.104.22.170|talk]]) it appeared in the Guinness book of world records, hence the name of the record

Undid revision 455878245 by [[Special:Contributions/Journalist|Journalist]] ([[User talk:Journalist|talk]]) punctuation does not make it clear, and it was not a Guinness "world" record, it was a UK record.

clarified - both of these records as for albums by a female artist, not in general.

Global sales - plural therefore are not is. And if this is a question of US V UK English then this is an article about a UK singer.
/* Background and conception */ not just uk

says who? other pages include sales/shipments.
readers can guestimate how much the album has sold since then. If you want to change the source to 11 million, find a source that says so. Until then, the album has sold 10 million, as of September.
/* Certifications */ sales are NOT to be included
/* Certifications */ it is not confusing. on the contrary, it is quite helpful to know the sales/shipments from each country.
/* Certifications */ no sales. it makes it too confusing
[[Help:Reverting|Reverted]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/112.119.147.169|112.119.147.169]] ([[User talk:112.119.147.169|talk]]) to last version by 184.148.172.75
/* Certifications */ shipments/sales added. there are sources for sales in the section "Chart performance and accomplishments". feel free to correct.

the first sentence currently reads: '''''21''''' is the second studio album by English singer-songwriter [[Adele (singer)|Adele]], who is fat." I removed the last part saying she's fat, because it is unnecesarl
/* Europe */ Added Oceania to title; there are parts where it talks about the album's performance in Australia and New Zealand.
/* Song structure and lyrical themes */ quotes within quotes get single quotes; i fixed this

/* Influence and sound */ I don't think Lady A's pic is necessary for the article.

Undid revision 452478716 by [[Special:Contributions/Noreplyhaha|Noreplyhaha]] ([[User talk:Noreplyhaha|talk]]). Hmm. it's really not up to you to decide...see metacritic and allmusic sources in article body
Removed alternative rock from infobox...Adele isn't "alternative/indie rock" Alt rock is more Muse, Foo Fighters and an additional tag to pop punk bands like Simple Plan and Fall Out Boy.
/* Chart performance and accomplishments */ Split section
Undid revision 451801026 by [[Special:Contributions/201.53.134.118|201.53.134.118]] ([[User talk:201.53.134.118|talk]]) no twitter
changed "...adaptation of British slang..." to "...adaptation of slang...". Roll deep is not just a UK slang phrase, nor did it originate there.
/* Song structure and lyrical themes */ ing
/* Song structure and lyrical themes */ tidied a bit
/* Background and conception */ added nothing extra. he was her soulmate. end of story
/* Song structure and lyrical themes */ tweaked
/* Song structure and lyrical themes */ tidied, added
/* Song structure and lyrical themes */ tidied a bit

/* Critical reception */ rs says it received acclaim. based on the selective reviews that metacritic selected, they got a "generally positive reviews" score. but metacritic doesn't dictate the only response to the album
